meanings.definition: The thick end of a piece of yarn or thread.
meanings.sent1: She carefully tied a knot at the doup of the thread.
meanings.sent2: The doup of the yarn was frayed and needed trimming.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the doup, unraveling the entire ball of yarn.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was a tangled mess, resembling the doup of a thread.
meanings.sent5: The doup of the rope was so thick, it was hard to weave through the needle.

meanings.definition: To finish the end of a piece of yarn or thread by twisting it.
meanings.sent1: She would doup the yarn before starting her knitting project.
meanings.sent2: Remember to doup the thread to prevent it from unraveling.
meanings.sent3: He doupes the yarn with precision, ensuring a neat finish every time.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's movements were so fluid, it was as if she doupes the thread effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: With a quick twist, she doupes the end of the yarn, ready to sew.

meanings.definition: A thick, rounded piece at the end of a spindle.
meanings.sent1: The doup on the spindle helped secure the thread in place.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate design of the doup on the spindle.
meanings.sent3: The doup on the spindle looked like a tiny crown atop the spinning wheel.
meanings.sent4: As the spindle spun, the doup created mesmerizing patterns in the thread.
meanings.sent5: The doup on the spindle was worn from years of use, a testament to its craftsmanship.
